laboratory_examinations.findings: Lowest measured IOP was 8 mmHg; highest was 29 mmHg, with an average range of 13.5 to 17.9 mmHg.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Over 8 years, IOP ranged from 15 to 19 mmHg in both eyes, with no significant change in optic nerve appearance or visual field defect.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Common visual field defect was an arcuate defect in 31.3% of patients, with stable visual field defects over 7 years.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: There were no significant changes in visual field defects during the 7-year follow-up period.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Cup-to-disc ratios ranged from 0.20 to 0.95, averaging 0.56.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: There was no significant progression in cup-to-disc ratios during follow-up.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Optic nerve appearance was stable with no confirmed clinically significant progression.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Baseline stereo fundus photographs compared with subsequent examinations showed no optic nerve progression.
